p: LB film based light emitting device can utilize the ability of LB technique to organize the molecules in an ordered arrangement. For example, polarized light emission cab be achieved due to preferential alignment of molecules in LB films [ 136, 137]. LB technique offers the opportunity to manipulate the position and orientation of the luminescent species by controlling various LB parameters within metal mirror microcavities [138]. In order to enhance the lifetime of OLEDs several experiments on MEH-PPV LB films [139] have been done. Mixed LB films of pyridine and oxadiazole have been used which showed further increase in the electron-injection [139].
